Starstorm:

"A warrior alive is more useful than one death" replied 
Starstorm "You can fight and win other day... A wise Warrior knows 
when retreat and when fight"



--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Vlad: Let warriors deal with the lower castes as they see fit. As 
for 
> your friend, (he turns to Starstorm) battling a stronger enemy and 
> dying is not a sign of stupidity, but a proof of honor and value. 
He 
> died a warrior.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > Phoenix::
> > 
> > "I -" Phoenix turns away.  Her voice becomes choking, as she 
reaches 
> > into a past she'd much rather leave buried.  "I was a slave of 
the 
> > Rogues.  They ... they thought it was good strategy to blow up a 
> > bunch of innocent civilians .... It was a living nightmare, 
watching 
> > them do their dirty work.  F-Flicker rescued me; that's why I'm 
> here."
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "airly2000" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> > > Starstorm::
> > > 
> > > "He fought like a tru idiot, you wanna meat Vlad" replied  
> > > Startorm "He try to destroy a bot who was more powerful than 
him" 
> > and 
> > > looking to Phoenix asked curiously"Wher have you seen masacres, 
> > have 
> > > you been a soldier once in your life?"
> > > 
> > >

> > > > Phoenix shudders as old memories resurface.  "Thanks, I've 
seen 
> > WAY 
> > > > too much killing in my life - at least the part I remember."

display,

> > > > > but 
> > > > > > she's not sure who Starstorm is talking about.
> > > > > >
